borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <div><span style="font-size: 11pt;">The proposed first floor&nbsp;rear extension by reason of bulky appearance and unbalancing of the property constitutes to an overdevelopment of the original dwellinghouse. Furthermore, it&nbsp;also&nbsp;represents a&nbsp;poor quality internal layout.&nbsp;Therefore, the proposed first floor rear extension is considered harmful to the appearance of the house, built form of the terrace and character of the area.</span>&nbsp;As such, the proposed development is contrary to:</div><div><br></div><div>- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);</div><div>- Policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (March 2016);</div><div>- Policy D4 of the Draft London Plan Intended to Publish (December 2019);</div><div>- Policy CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);</div><div>- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);</div><div>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);</div><div>- Policies SP4, DM11 and DM16 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 18 Consultation version, November 2019).</div><div>-&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 11pt;">Policy SP 2 of the Draft Local Plan,&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">Policy DMD 1 of&nbsp;the Draft Local Plan,&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">Policy DMD 6&nbsp;of&nbsp;the Draft Local Plan&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">(Regulation 19&nbsp;Consultation&nbsp;Version, September 2020).&nbsp;</span></div>

<p style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51);"><span style="font-size: 11pt;">The proposed porch&nbsp;by reason of its scale, height, and its poor alignment with the bay window feature, overly&nbsp;dominates the front elevations of the property. Therefore, the proposed porch consitutes a poor quality addition to the front elevations of the&nbsp;dwellinghouse, to the detriment of the wider street scene</span>.<span style="font-size: 11pt;">&nbsp;</span>As such, the proposed development is contrary to:<br></p><div style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51);"><br></div><div style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51);">- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);</div><div style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51);">- Policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (March 2016);</div><div style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51);">- Policy D4 of the Draft London Plan Intended to Publish (December 2019);</div><div style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51);">- Policy CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);</div><div style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51);">- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);</div><div style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51);">- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);</div><div style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51);">- Policies SP4, DM11 and DM16 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 18 Consultation version, November 2019).&nbsp;</div><div style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51);">-&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 11pt;">Policy SP 2 of the Draft Local Plan,&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">Policy DMD 1 of&nbsp;the Draft Local Plan,&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">Policy DMD 6&nbsp;of&nbsp;the Draft Local Plan&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">(Regulation 19&nbsp;Consultation&nbsp;Version, September 2020).&nbsp;</span></div>
description: Construction of a front porch, two storey side extension and part two storey part single storey rear extension.
